H0.text: The works of artists De Chirico, Andr Breton, Mir, Magritte, Dal and Ernst are examples of what art movement. Dadaism

H1.text: The works of artists De Chirico, Andr Breton, Mir, Magritte, Dal and Ernst are examples of what art movement. Cubism

H2.text: The works of artists De Chirico, Andr Breton, Mir, Magritte, Dal and Ernst are examples of what art movement. Futurism

H3.text: The works of artists De Chirico, Andr Breton, Mir, Magritte, Dal and Ernst are examples of what art movement. Surealism

A4.text: Surrealism is an art and cultural movement that developed in Europe in the aftermath of World War I in which artists aimed to allow the unconscious mind to express itself, often resulting in the depiction of illogical or dreamlike scenes and ideas.

A5.text: The works of Surrealism feature the element of surprise, unexpected juxtapositions and non sequitur.
